item.title: Batch file for ftp’ing files…
item.description:
Today I came across a requirement where users needed to ftp files time and again. So ftp’ing again and again is not a very good option. I wrote a small batch file for the same. Just sharing the same over here. I created a folder ftp in C drive and a file get_file.bat Contents of get_file.bat are:

[sourcecode language=‘css’]

set /p file_name=Enter the name of the file you want to ftp: echo oracle>c:\ftp\param.cfg echo oracle123»c:\ftp\param.cfg echo cd /home/oracle»c:\ftp\param.cfg echo lcd c:\ftp»c:\ftp\param.cfg bin get %file_name% ftp -s:param.cfg 127.0.0.1
